_header: Thou that weared the crown of thorns
Subjects: clothing, against extremes of; women, against
_description: Against excesses in women’s dress — eight lines (aabbbbcc) with concluding couplet

BodAsh59.First Lines:
þou þat werred þe crowne of thornesffell dovne
                    þe pryde of wommens hornesAnd suffre hem longer with longe
                    taylesNe none oþer vicyous entayles…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Lord for þy peyneful passyounTo save oure soule frome
                    dampnacoun
BodAsh59.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Historical Poems of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1959: 139.
